issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: There's a potential security hole in the task-controller as it stands. Based on the discussion on general@, removing task-controller from the 0.22 branch will pave way for 0.22.0 release. (This was done for the 0.21.0 release as well: see MAPREDUCE-2014.) We can roll a 0.22.1 release with the task-controller when it is fixed.

comments.body: Removed LinuxTaskController, associated tests, and C++ files. Modified build.xml to not build task-controller.
Patch submitted for hudson testing. Tested locally.
Cancelling patch, and re-submitting to see if the (now available) jenkins picks it up.
Submitting for tests to run.
Hey Milind, I'm pretty sure you have to actually attach a new patch. Simply going Patch Available -> Open -> Patch Available isn't sufficient, I believe.
Following @atm's directions.
Attaching the same patch as before for jenkins to pick up.
Dear jenkins, please pick up the patch.

Aren't we trying to remove the entire palm because one nail grew ugly?
We can just turn it off by throwing, e.g. UnsupportedOperationException on an attempt to use it. And then turn it back on when the fix is provided.

That will cause test-failures etc. I think removing it entirely is the cleanest way of turning it off.


---
Milind Bhandarkar
(typing on glass, please ignore spelling mistakes)

For some time after the merge of three projects (common, hdfs, mapreduce), the test-patch ant target was broken (since it tried to apply the patch from inside the mapreduce directory (where build.xml exists), whereas the patch is generated from the top level. This never got fixed in the 0.22 branch, and so my "ant test-patch" is failing in the patch application step.

After manually applying the patch, I ran ant test in mapreduce directory, and I get only unrelated failures.
New patch that fixes the build.xml merge issues.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12492500/MR2767new.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 46 new or modified tests.

    -1 patch.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/574//console

This message is automatically generated.

Attaching the log of "ant test". There were two failures: testMiniMRChildTask, and testDFSIO. testDFSIO is definitely unrelated. I have attached testMiniMRChildTask log, which looks unrelated as well.
Re: the comment by Hadoop QA: this patch is not for trunk. It's only for 0.22 branch.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12492529/TEST-org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestMiniMRChildTask.txt
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 152 new or modified tests.

    -1 patch.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/580//console

This message is automatically generated.
Milind, you need to do this for trunk, 0.22 and 0.23 - we shouldn't have the LTC in any branch. Can you please provide a patch? Thanks.
@Arun, LTC changes made in 0.20.203 have not propagated to 0.23 and trunk ? I thought the race condition fix is already in trunk/0.23, no ?
Aha. Okay, will do.
Attaching patches for 0.22, 0.23, and trunk.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12492662/MR2767-trunk.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 46 new or modified tests.

    -1 patch.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/585//console

This message is automatically generated.
Removing conflict in trunk due to recent commits. Re-did patch for trunk.
Cancelling, and re-making patch-available.
Making patch available for trunk.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12492764/MR2767-trunk.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 46 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce 8 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-mapreduce-project.

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.
